column4: If I leave de CD to work, it will go past the "little human and keyboard" to the splash with ubuntu logo and the 5 little dots. They blink for a while, then the screen flashes and goes blank. If, at the "human and keyboard" I hit space, I get the menu. I followed all 3 solutions here (http://journalxtra.com/2010/07/ubuntu-fixing-the-blank-screen-on-installation-bug/) that is how I get the "broken but not blank" screen. Since that post is about a
notebook with graphics issue, and that *changes* the symptoms for me, I'm thinking Graphics Adapter... I don't know what other options I can try, though.
I tried Desktop versions for 10.10 and 11.04, but thei fail as well...
you tried the alternate CD for those versions?
I'd heard of them, but no. I'll try 11.04 now, I assume that's best for G. Adapter coverage. Do I assume right?
I don't know about G. Adapter coverage, but if the computer is older, you might go with 10.04
11.10 requires a bit more video horsepower than previous releases to work well
I'm downloading 10.04, let's see where that takes me. Thanks.

while I'm downloading, I've tried some different settings (as per that link I mentioned above), I was able to get to a prompt, ubuntu@ubuntu, before which there was a message about missing CPU security features. ("your cpu appears to be lacking expected security protections"). Does that say anything to you?
but it shouldn't be a huge worry IMHO
I messed around with the bios, so I'm gonna reset it and see what happens! :)
I think we've all been there ;-)
wanna type something? I'll proxy it! ;)
neat text mode blue screen. fingers crossed.
it is complaining I don't have a CD-ROM in the driver.... that's not right.
